Class freecell

  • java.lang.Object
    • freecell

  • public class freecell
extends java.lang.Object

    Freecell Game

    This is a class that contains a Freecell game which is a card game in command prompt.

    The goal of this game is to transfer all the cards from the columns to the piles according to the ranks and suits.

    User needs to enter the command based on this format: source, selected card, destination .

    User can also enter 'r' to restart the game, 'x' to exit the game and just enter one column number to rotate the column.

    • Method Detail

      • cls

        public static void cls()
        This is a clear screen function.

      • display

        public static void display()
        This function displays the board of the Freecell game.

        The board consists of four stacks of piles and nine stacks of columns.

      • create

        public static void create()
        This function random distributes cards on certain columns when the game starts / restarts.

      • displayMessage

        public static void displayMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        This function displays error message based on the invalid command.
        Parameters:
        msg - The error message generated

      • indexSearch

        public static int indexSearch(java.lang.String card)
        This function searches for the index of the rank of a selected card (Accroding to the default order of the ranks) .
        Parameters:
        card - The selected card that needs to be searched for its rank's index
        Returns:
        The index of the rank (-1 if index not found)

      • inOrder

        public static boolean inOrder(int source,
                              java.lang.String card)
        This function checks whether the bunch of cards selected is in order to be moved.

        The current card must be one rank bigger than the card to its right

        Parameters:
        source - The source column that contains the selected card
        card - The selected card by user
        Returns:
        True if the card(s) start from the selected card is in order (in terms of the ranks), False if not in order

      • move

        public static void move(int source,
                        java.lang.String card,
                        char destination)
        This function mvoes the selected card(s) to the destination.

        Actions:

        1. Remove card(s) from the source column

        2. Add card(s) to the destination column / pile

        Parameters:
        source - The source column that contains the selected card
        card - The selected card by user
        destination - The destination column or pile

      • destination_ready

        public static boolean destination_ready(int source,
                                        java.lang.String card,
                                        char destination)
        This function checks whether the condition of destination pile / column is suitable to move cards.

        Suitable conditions (For destination pile):

        1. All the selected card(s) are same suit

        2. The suit of the destination pile is same as the suit of the card(s)

        3. Last element of destination pile / column are in correct order to move the selected card(s)

        4. First card in an empty pile must be 'A'

        Suitable conditions (For destination column):

        1. First of the selected card(s) must be one rank lower than the last element of destination column

        Parameters:
        source - The source column that contains the selected card
        card - The selected card by user
        destination - The destination column or pile
        Returns:
        True if the condition of destination is suitable to move card(s), False if vice versa

      • rotate

        public static void rotate(char columnChar)
        This function rotates a column which move the last card to the front of the column.
        Parameters:
        columnChar - The column that needs to be rotated by user

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main function that runs automatically.

        Input will be received here and input validation will happen here

        Parameters:
        args - command-line arguments
